p: Two compounds found in Pangi leaves, bis (3, 5, 5-trimethylhexyl) phthalate and ethyl cholate, have the potential to be developed as anti-SARS-CoV-2 drugs, due to their good binding affinity with M pro and S protein and also because they meet the Ro5. Although there is no prior information about their oral availability, both compounds were reported to inhibit HIV-1 protease in silico.
